citation.abstract: We investigated the association between prevalence of symptoms and health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in adult survivors of childhood cancer enrolled in the St Jude Lifetime Cohort study.
citation.title: Association Between the Prevalence of Symptoms and Health-Related Quality of Life in Adult Survivors of Childhood Cancer: A Report From the St Jude Lifetime Cohort Study

news.title: Adult survivors of childhood cancer at risk of becoming frail at an early age
news.summary: St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital study finds that young adults who had cancer as children are more likely to be frail than their peers; this condition leaves survivors at increased risk of death and chronic disease.

news.title: Adult Survivors of Childhood Cancer at Risk of Becoming Frail at an Early Age
news.summary: Young adults who survived childhood cancer are more likely than their peers to be frail, according to a St. Jude Children's Research Hospital study, which reported the condition is more common among female survivors than women decades older.

news.title: Childhood Cancer Treatment Takes Toll on Hearts of Survivors
news.summary: Cancer treatment takes a toll on the hearts of child survivors, according to research presented at the American Heart Association's Scientific Sessions 2013. Cancer is the leading cause of disease-related death among U.S. children, but the rate of survival

news.title: Childhood Cancer Survivors Age Faster than Others
news.summary: People who survive cancer at a tender age are at a high risk of aging faster than their peers. A latest study has shown that childhood cancer survivors have increased chances of developing chronic diseases and becoming frail at a young age.
